title: Cauliflower soup with bacon dust

ingredients.content: 60 g Parmesan cheese, crust removed and cut into pieces (3 cm)
950 g cauliflower, cut into small florets (3 cm)
3 pinches ground black pepper, to taste
25 g butter or olive oil, to taste

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 200째C. Line a baking tray with baking paper and place bacon rashers onto it.
Bake for 20 minutes (200째C), or until very crispy. Lay out bacon on paper towel and ensure all liquid is absorbed. Allow bacon to cool and dry out.
Once cooled and dry, place bacon into mixing bowl and mill <b>20 sec/speed 9<b>. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place Parmesan into mixing bowl and grate <b>10 sec/speed 9<b>. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place water, stock paste, cauliflower, salt and pepper into mixing bowl and cook <b>20 min/100째C/speed 1<b>.
Add butter or olive oil and cook <b>5 min/100째C/speed 1<b>, then blend <b>1 min 30 sec/speed 5<b>-9, increasing speed gradually<b> <b>from speed 5 to speed 9.<b>
Serve soup hot with reserved Parmesan cheese, topped with a sprinkle of bacon dust.

hintsAndTricks: <b>Bacon truffle cauliflower soup<b>: add 150 g cooked bacon pieces, to taste when serving and substitute the butter with 1-2 tsp truffle oil for a slightly more decadent flavour.
Please refer to The Basic Cookbook for the Vegetable stock paste recipe.
Serve hot with fresh crusty bread on the side.
